block.p: No, the Internet isn't everywhere, but it will be by next year. That's when when Verizon Communications, the corporate successor to Bell Atlantic, sends out its new phone books, in which people will be able to list e-mail and personal Web page addresses, along with their phone numbers. The annual cost is $36 for each listing.
Verizon plans to make the service available throughout its territory -- New York, New England and the mid-Atlantic state.

No, the Internet isn't everywhere, but it will be by next year. That's when when Verizon Communications, the corporate successor to Bell Atlantic, sends out its new phone books, in which people will be able to list e-mail and personal Web page addresses, along with their phone numbers. The annual cost is $36 for each listing.
Verizon plans to make the service available throughout its territory -- New York, New England and the mid-Atlantic state.
''E-mail is how people are communicating now,'' said MaryBeth Masterson, product manager of white pages for Verizon.
